body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many triplets of integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a, b, c) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are there such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4 + b^4 + c^4 = 2 a^2b^2 + 2 b^2c^2 + 2 c^2a^2 + 2014? "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^4 + b^4 + c^4 - 2a^2b^2 - 2b^2c^2 - 2a^2c^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2)^2 - 4a^2b^2 + c^4 -2c^2(a^2 + b^2) = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2 -c^2)^2 - 4a^2b^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2 - c^2 - 2ab)(a^2 + b^2 -c^2 + 2ab) = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there are integer solutions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2014 = 2 \times 1007 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", one and only one of the terms must be divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But since the terms differ by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 4ab "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", if one term is divisible by 2, the other term MUST be divisble by 2, which leads to a contradiction. Therefore, there exist no integer solutions and the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \boxed{0} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Observation  : The right hand side of the given equation is even. Hence the left hand side must also be even. This gives rise to two cases."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1 : a,b,c are all even. In that case "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4+b^4+c^4-2a^2b^2-2b^2c^2-2c^2a^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 16, while 2014 is not. Hence this case is not possible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2: two of a,b,c are odd, the other one is even. Without any loss of generality, assume "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are odd. Then it is easy to verify that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2=1\mod(4),b^2=1 \mod (4), c^2=0 \mod(4)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4+b^4+c^4-2a^2b^2-2b^2c^2-2c^2a^2 \mod(4)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", while 2014 is not divisible by 4. Hence this case is also not possible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus there does not exist any solution to this diophantine equation. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\blacksquare"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there's a solution, because variable are replaceable with their additive inverse, then without the loss of the generality, we may assume that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 0 \leq a \leq b \leq c "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", rearrange the equation and we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c^2-b^2)^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which doesn't have integer solution because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a perfect square. So they are all positive integers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1 \leq  a^4 + b^4 + c^4 \leq 2014 < 7^4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \leq a \leq b \leq c \leq 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{RHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", if we have all three of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are even numbers, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2^4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{LHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but doesn't divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{RHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is absurd. So the triplets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must have two odd numbers and one even number. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Noting that one of the variation of Heron's Formula is, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{Area } = \frac {1}{4} \sqrt{ 2\left (a^2 b^2+ a^2 c^2+b^2 c^2 \right) - \left (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 \right ) } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we assume "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are lengths of the triangle (possible degenerate triangle), then the area of the triangle is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac {\sqrt{-2014}}{4} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is invalid. So they can't be the lengths of a triangle. Thus, we have another constraint "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b<c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So with constraints:  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \leq a \leq b \leq c \leq 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the triplets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must have two odd numbers and one even number. "}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b < c "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there's only a couple of trial and errors we need to carry out to determine whether they satisfy the given equation"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1,4) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1,6) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,2,5) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,3,6) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we have exhausted all possible scenario, there's no integer solution to the given equation."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The smallest integer of a set of consecutive integers is -32.
